intro: Cyphostemma connivens, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, horn-shaped fruits. It is often found in rocky or wooded areas and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
